ratings.comment: Derek is a good professor and 421 has useful content. There is a lot of homework, so the experience may be unpleasant if you have a heavy schedule. There were two take home exams without time limits, which I thought was an stress-free way to assess your learning. The readings aren't necessary to succeed as long as your keep up with lectures.
I have so much homework! I've never seen an assignment question that actually contains two entire large questions from the textbook.

LOTS OF HOMEWORK. We received five large assignments weekly, with each assignment containing five or more sub-questions. My review is factual and free of any profanity or derogatory terms, but it appears someone reported it despite my effort to share an honest experience.

Derek is passionate about stats and is great at breaking down concepts in lecture. He doesn't post any notes or recordings online though, so it's important to go. He's helpful and patient during office hours and replies quickly on piazza & email. His exams are difficult (which is reflected in the low means), but he curved the class quite a bit.

His lectures were really good (besides the coding demos). Attendance doesn't matter and all lecture notes/code on Canvas for you to use. The class was 66% homework (13 assigns total/4-6+ hr/week) and 2 take-home exams that aren't too bad. The HW is relentless, but it taught me R better than all my other stats classes and was my second to last one.
Bean's greatest strength is his organization and attention to detail. Course was challenging but straightforward in terms of work to be completed and grading criteria.

Terrible handwriting , can barely read his words sometimes. Teaching is very messy. Had to self-study from the textbook the entire semester. I have taken many lvl 600 courses and Stat 312 under him has been the hardest of the hardest course I have ever taken. If you have a choice, choose Ismor Fischer.
Bean is an awesome professor. Take his course if you have a chance.

Went to office hours every week for homework/lecture questions and never once felt like I was bothering him; he always seemed enthusiastic to answer my questions. The one-on-one instruction was a breath of fresh air given that the class was entirely online. If you need help, go to office hours! He will be more than happy to help.

Derek is pretty decent at teaching the material that will be on the exams. Make sure you go to lecture, because the notes have a lot of statistical nomenclature that is only explained in lecture. You can use 3 sheets of notes on the exam, so memorization isn't a problem. Fairly light workload, Just keep up on the material and you will do well.

Easy compared to other stat371 professors.  Homework was worth 30% of the grade, and you could easily get 100% on each one.  The two midterms and final exam were very easy.  It was enough to go through the homework, discussion worksheets, and lectures before tests.  You also 1 sheet of paper for the 1st test, 2 for the 2nd, 3 for the final exam

Prof. Bean was an average professor. He wasn't superb, but he also wasn't terrible. He lectures by writing the notes during class on an overhead projector. DO NOT SKIP  class, because he doesn't post the notes online, just very brief lecture summaries. Also DO NOT slack off on homework! As it's worth 30 percent of your grade and isnt too difficult!

He writes out his lecture notes by hand and uses lots of examples, making material easy to follow and learning the equations/etc very straightforward. That being said, there are no lecture slides/notes so go to lecture! Put in effort on the homework and study old discussion sheets and you're good. You also get note sheets for all exams!
